tables.name: workspace
tables.description: Represents each tenantâ€™s registered Slack workspace.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Human-readable display name of the Slack workspace as configured by workspace administrators. Used for identification and logging purposes.

columns.name: bot_token
columns.description: OAuth bot token with scope permissions for posting messages, reading channels, and accessing workspace information. Encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption for security compliance.

columns.name: signing_secret
columns.description: Slack application signing secret used to verify that incoming requests are genuinely from Slack. Required for webhook authentication and security validation. Encrypted using the same key as bot_token.

columns.name: app_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the Slack application as registered in the Slack App Directory. Used for app-specific API calls and identifying the source of bot interactions.

columns.name: bot_user_id
columns.description: Unique user identifier for the bot within the workspace. Used to identify bot messages and prevent the bot from responding to its own messages in conversations.

columns.name: default_channel_id
columns.description: Fallback channel ID for notifications when no specific channel is configured or available. Must be a channel where the bot has posting permissions.

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: Global toggle for Slack integration functionality. When false, all notifications to this workspace are disabled, useful for maintenance or temporary suspension.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace this channel belongs to. Establishes the parent-child relationship between workspace and channels for multi-tenant support.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key linking template to its workspace. Enables workspace-specific template customization and multi-tenant template isolation.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace these operational settings apply to. Allows per-workspace customization of retry logic and behavior.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

tables.name: channel
tables.description: Represents known or approved Slack channels in the workspace.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique Slack channel identifier provided by Slack API. Used for all channel-specific operations including message posting and permissions validation.

columns.name: name
columns.description: Human-readable channel name as displayed in Slack, including the # prefix for public channels. Used for display purposes and channel identification in logs.

columns.name: workspace_id
columns.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace this channel belongs to. Establishes the parent-child relationship between workspace and channels for multi-tenant support.

columns.name: is_private
columns.description: Indicates whether the channel is private (invitation-only) or public. Affects message visibility and bot permission requirements for posting notifications.

columns.name: is_dm
columns.description: Identifies direct message channels for one-on-one communication. DM channels require special handling and different permission scopes for bot access.

columns.name: topic
columns.description: Optional channel topic/description as set by channel administrators. Provides context about the channel's intended use and notification types.

columns.name: purpose
columns.description: Channel purpose statement describing its primary function and usage guidelines. Helps administrators understand notification routing decisions.

columns.name: subscribed_events
columns.description: Array of event types this channel subscribes to receive notifications for. Supports filtering and routing specific events to appropriate channels based on business rules.

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: Channel-level toggle for notification delivery. When disabled, notifications intended for this channel will be redirected to the workspace default channel.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace this channel belongs to. Establishes the parent-child relationship between workspace and channels for multi-tenant support.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Unique Slack channel identifier provided by Slack API. Used for all channel-specific operations including message posting and permissions validation.

tables.name: template
tables.description: Stores reusable templates for Slack messages (both plain text and block-based).

columns.name: code
columns.description: Unique template identifier used for programmatic template selection. Must follow snake_case naming convention for consistency with application code.

columns.name: workspace_id
columns.description: Foreign key linking template to its workspace. Enables workspace-specific template customization and multi-tenant template isolation.

columns.name: name
columns.description: User-friendly template name displayed in admin interfaces and template selection menus. Should clearly describe the template's purpose and usage context.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Detailed description of the template's purpose, when to use it, and any special considerations. Helps administrators choose appropriate templates for specific notification scenarios.
columns.example: Alert template for payment processing failures requiring immediate attention

columns.name: content_blocks
columns.description: Slack Block Kit JSON structure defining the visual layout and interactive elements of the message. Supports rich formatting, buttons, and dynamic content replacement.

columns.name: variables
columns.description: Array of variable names that can be dynamically replaced in the template content. Each variable corresponds to a placeholder in content_blocks using {{variableName}} syntax.

columns.name: sample_payload
columns.description: Example data structure showing realistic values for all template variables. Used for template testing, preview generation, and developer documentation.

columns.name: enabled
columns.description: Template availability toggle. Disabled templates cannot be used for new notifications but existing scheduled notifications will continue to use them.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key linking template to its workspace. Enables workspace-specific template customization and multi-tenant template isolation.

keys.name: code
keys.description: Unique template identifier used for programmatic template selection. Must follow snake_case naming convention for consistency with application code.

tables.name: app_config
tables.description: High-level operational configuration for the Slack app itself.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Auto-incrementing primary key for app configuration records. Each workspace typically has one configuration record.

columns.name: workspace_id
columns.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace these operational settings apply to. Allows per-workspace customization of retry logic and behavior.

columns.name: max_retry_attempts
columns.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for failed message deliveries before marking as permanently failed. Higher values increase reliability but consume more resources.

columns.name: retry_backoff_seconds
columns.description: Initial delay in seconds between retry attempts. Actual delay may use exponential backoff strategy to avoid overwhelming Slack API rate limits.

columns.name: default_locale
columns.description: Default language/locale for message content when user-specific locale is not available. Follows ISO 639-1 language codes combined with ISO 3166-1 country codes.

columns.name: logging_enabled
columns.description: Controls whether detailed message delivery logs are recorded for audit and debugging purposes. Essential for compliance and troubleshooting failed deliveries.

columns.name: audit_channel_id
columns.description: Optional dedicated channel for system operational logs, error reports, and delivery confirmations. Separate from business notification channels for administrative clarity.

columns.name: metadata
columns.description: Flexible JSON object for storing additional workspace-specific configuration options, feature flags, and custom settings that don't warrant dedicated columns.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace these operational settings apply to. Allows per-workspace customization of retry logic and behavior.

keys.name: id
keys.description: Auto-incrementing primary key for app configuration records. Each workspace typically has one configuration record.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace this channel belongs to. Establishes the parent-child relationship between workspace and channels for multi-tenant support.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key linking template to its workspace. Enables workspace-specific template customization and multi-tenant template isolation.

parentColumn.name: id
parentColumn.description: Unique identifier for the Slack workspace/team, provided by Slack API during OAuth installation. This is the primary key linking all workspace-specific configurations.

childColumn.name: workspace_id
childColumn.description: Foreign key reference to the workspace these operational settings apply to. Allows per-workspace customization of retry logic and behavior.
